I don't see anyway to navigate "back".  There should also be a "home" button.  Every screen should have a back button that goes back one screen.  Every screen should also have a home button that takes you out to the dashboard

The back button doesn't do anything (its greyed out).  It looks like you still have a long way to go with each tool (tool = each section that the dashboard leads to) to match the equivalency of the app i built in vibecodeapp
Just work from top to bottom on the tools
Just keep going
keep going.  You shouldn't keep stopping
quit stopping.  Just continue on as you complete one task, continue onto the next without needing further prompts
keep going
keep going

it doesn't really look like the html app i sent you at all...  There should be zero user-facing differences between the html app i sent you and what I want you to build.  I understand the code to get to the exact same user-facing funcionality might be different but the user-facing features/functionalities/views/print functions/modal views/etc... should be EXACTLY the same
keep going
keep going
keep going
keep going

getting closer.  what is the calculate button?  calculations should update with the entry of each field.  You have most all the functionality correct, however, it isn't an exact user-facing replication of the html i provided.  it is real close, but I like the html i provided exactly the way it is, with the exception of 1 thing i like on yours.  I like that the graph shows up on the data entry page too and hopefully updates with each field entry.  Also, the workflow should be very efficient by keyboard.  Tab or enter should move right to the next field.

put the washed weight after the "Pan" data field for entry efficiency.  and in the edit sieve configuration for aggregates, when you click select, it doesn't allow you to click any fractional sieve size.  only the # sieves.  Guessing this has something to do with the quotations possibly as that has created issues before
it seems to only allow one keystroke and then it backs out and i have to click in the fields again and enter another 1 digit and this repeats.  Can you review everywhere to ensure this is fixed?

I can't click edit on the concrete sand or kraemer 9/16... Also, I don't need toggle up and down to set the upper and lower limits.  its still only allowing only one keystroke in every field i tested.. i click in the field, type one digit (or delete) and it backs out (so the field is not active i guess you could say).. then i have to click back in the field to type or key one more digit, and i have to repeat this process for each digit i need in that box

both of those problems are fixed now but it enters values backwards... for example, i try to type 40 and it types the 4 and then when i hit the 0 it puts it to the left of the 4 making it 04 rather than 40...  you can also get rid of the up and down toggles for the upper and lower limits...  make the repository button say records instead... the graphs are backwards... the x-axis should have the sieves largest to smallest from left to right

after that, make an option to pick a date at the top of the test page that you can apply to all tests (gradations)... also make an option to choose "No production" button and select two dates where there was no production (start date and end date)... please reference the html i sent you for how these two tasks were performed..

retained on sieve values should allow decimals to 1 digit after the decimal.. and lets put the total weight (automatically calculated) after all the retained on sieve values and before the washed weight value... but the user should experience a clean workflow that skips over the total value (since this is a calculated value) when hitting enter or tab and moves to the washed weight value... then obviously get rid of the total weight display on the right side above the graph.  you can also get rid of the status display altogether... so this should leave you with only F.M. and decant above the graph.  This should open up some room to make the graph taller
the total weight value should still stay in line with the weight retained column
it still isn't allowing decimal values at all.  I want to be able to add decimal to 1 digit following the decimal
still can't enter decimals in the weight retained values...
also make sure washed weight can also handle 1 decimal digit (4.1, for example)
hitting enter after entering the weight retained value for the pan doesn't pass the cursor down to the washed weight entry field
put a dash in the percent passing in the pan row.. the same dash that's in that row's value for upper and lower limits
the percent passing values should be rounded to the nearest 1%

Can i deploy this and continue to work on it after deploying?  Its going to need a backend for storage of records/data.  All users on different machines need to see the records so local storage is not an option
Yeah I want to take care of creating a front end and backend right now
also take into account that I want to have mobile apps that are the exact equivalent of this web app... that includes storage locations as well need to be shared with the mobile apps when created
and to clarify, the backend and front end will be used for everything in the app, not just the gradation tool
do it all
in the camber calculator strand pattern manager, lets remove all the options that relate to json

in the strand pattern manager, in the new strand pattern creator, there's no need e value, pulling force, moment of inertia, or dead load... most of these values will be better suited elsewhere in the app.  Also, i'm not sure how the strand sizes (comma separated) should be entered... sometimes in strand patterns there is a few strand slightly higher (maybe 2") than the bottom row... its still considered bottom strand though and is still a part of the given strand pattern
we can get rid of pattern name as well.  Pattern ID identifies it enough

i was mistaken, we do need the pulling force.  but it should be in a percent value, and this percent value is percent of minimum break strength from the strand library values.. however, some of the default strands in the strand library need corrected values...  all elastic modulus should be 28600ksi...7/16 250 area should be 0.108 and breaking strength should be 27000... 1/2 250 area should be 0.144 and break strength should be 36000... there should be no 0.6 250... 3/8 270 area should be 0.085

in the new strand pattern creator, instead of the "strand sizes (optional)" field, lets make the fields dynamic based on the quantities of each strand entered in the 3/8" strands, 1/2" strands, and 0.6" strands fields.  For example, if i type in 2 for 1/2" and 5 for 0.6"... then the strand coordinates shouldn't be just one field, it should populate (2) 1/2" (coordinates) fields and (5) 0.6" (coordinates) fields...
in the new strand pattern creator, the total strand area should be a calculated value based on the number of each size strand times the area values from the strand library for those sizes
I guess we should probably have quantity fields for each size AND grade, since 1/2 250 has a different area than 1/2 270, for example
any inch measurements throughout the app should be able to be typed in ft
any imperial measurements throughout the app should be able to be typed in ft'-in. fraction" or decimal inches... for example, 2 1/8 or 2.125, 1'-6.75" or 1'-6 3/4"
